title: Oxide+Friends 3/17/2023 -- On Silicon Valley Bank with Eric Vishria

last_post.content:
On a rare Friday show, @bcantrill and I were joined by special guest Eric Vishria of Benchmark and only slightly-less-special guest @sdtuck. The topic was the failure of SVB, its impact on startups, and the special role the SVB played in supporting and nurturing startups. SVB understood the ecosystem and did a surprising amount behind the scenes to facilitate it. Not to excuse mistakes, but its failure leaves a void.

Thanks again to Eric!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pYrlCv-bwDk

title: The Model That Changes Everything: Alpaca Breakthrough (ft. Apple's LLM, BritGPT, Ernie and AlexaTM)

last_post.content:
Stanford has created an AI model called Stanford Alpaca.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xslW5sQOkC8

It's capable of doing what ChatGPT does and more, except at a fraction of the cost: $600. They were allowed to do this because Alpaca didn't have to be trained same as GPT was, it only had to learn all of GPT's tricks watching GPT play.

Microsoft placed a $2 billion bet on OpenAI, so that makes them look $2 billion less smart than last week.
https://the-decoder.com/stanfords-alpaca-shows-that-openai-may-have-a-problem/

#OpenAI #AGI #gpt #chatgpt #StanfordAlpaca

One of my favorite animals is the very rare blanket octopus. Few people have seen them firsthand. https://youtu.be/QJcXMPJ9XN8

The female has a spectacular ‘cape’ enclosing her tentacles, which makes her look larger to predators. She can grow >6.5ft or 2m!

Meanwhile, the male is smaller than a walnut. He weighs 40,000x less than the female measuring 2.4cm.

Blanket octopus are the most extreme example of female vs male size discrepancy across the (non-mircoscopic) animal kingdom. #nature #science

title: St. Francis - Brother Sun, Sister Moon - The Conversion Scene

last_post.content:
I need to pick a time this #Lent to re-watch #BrotherSunSisterMoon, about the life of #StFrancisOfAssissi. You can watch the conversion scene here, where he rejects his life in a wealthy, respected family to wander off and live outside the village: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ev2d92_W47Y

St Francis represents some of the best fundamentalism I've seen come out of Christianity: reject hierarchical social orders, live a simple life, free yourself from social constructs, and try to live in the natural splendor of creation, as the animals do.

We are about to cross 1.5 degrees of warming.

The arctic has already warmed 4 degrees, the Northern Hemisphere, which is mostly land (and includes the arctic) is already up 1.5 degrees, and now it looks like the whole world will cross the Paris Accord's 1.5 degrees target either this year or next year, as soon as the Pacific weather pattern changes from La Nina to El Nino. And #biden just approved the #willow project. Sigh.

https://youtu.be/8MorE-4FGbo?t=152

Putting Samsung’s “fake” moon photos to the test.

After a Redditor discovered that Samsung’s 100x “space zoom” feature may rely heavily on AI to spit out super crisp photos of the moon, YouTuber Marques Brownlee recreated the experiment with a Galaxy S23 Ultra.

His findings? Quite a bit less dramatic than what we saw on Reddit. The resulting moon photo seems equally as blurry as the original — save for some added brightness and sharpness — and doesn’t appear to add any details that weren’t there before.

www.youtube.com/watch?v=1afpDuTb-P0

title: A Plea for Improvisation | Jojo Mayer | TEDxZurich

last_post.content:
I am not a fan of TED talks, but I am fan of Jojo Mayer's music. I came across this 10-minute talk by Jojo on "A plea for improvisation".

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Npq-bhz1ll0

Okay, so this is interesting.

Someone loaded up a test version of Signal with "Phone Number Privacy" (that is, usernames) enabled.

A few different things to note:
- It is optional. You can skip this or disable your username any time.
- Usernames have a unique two-digit identifier attached to distinguish people with the same username.
- You can toggle whether your phone number is searchable and whether it can be seen by others

Check out the video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g81mBMGw6fo
